newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: RUGBY-SPRINGBOKS NAME ONE NEW CAP.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY-SPRINGBOKS NAME ONE NEW CAP.

text.p: Natal prop Adrian Garvey is the only new cap in the South African team to play the first test against Argentina here at the Ferro Carril Oeste Stadium on Saturday.

Garvey played for Zimbabwe 25 times including the 1991 World Cup, but qualified for the Springboks with a three-year residency earlier this year. Garvey takes over the tight head berth from Marius Hurter who is carrying several injuries.
Only three players remain from the team which started the first test at the same round in 1993, wings James Small and Jacques Olivier and flank Ruben Kruger.
Small returns to the team after serving a disciplinary sentence for most of the year in South Africa. Hennie le Roux has shaken off the effects of a bruised shin and takes his place in the midfield.
Springbok manager Andre Markgraaff has hinted that he will take full use of the new substitution laws which came into effect on November 2. He has opted for a 4-2 forward split on the bench.

South Africa are unbeaten against Argentina in four post isolation test and they will be favourites to continue their run against a Puma side lacking powerhouse props Patricio Noriega and Matias Corral.

Team: 15:Andre Joubert 14:James Small 13:Japie Mulder 12:Hennie le Roux 11:Jacques Olivier 10:Henry Honiball 9:Joost van der Westhuizen 8:Gary Teichmann (captain) 7:Andre Venter 6:Ruben Kruger 5:Mark Andrews 4:Kobus Wiese 3:Adrian Garvey 2:James Dalton 1:Dawie Theron.
Replacements: Andre Snyman, Kevin Putt, Fritz van Heerden, Wayne Fyvie, Toks van der Linde, Henry Tromp.
